* This is an enum for all the possible commands chatbot Christopher could take
TODO, DEADLINE, EVENT, LIST, BYE, MARK, UNMARK, DELETE, UNKNOWN;
* This method takes a command given by the user and match it to one of the enum types
* @return one of the enum listed above
* This is a form of task, specifically a task with a deadline attached
* Deadline is specified by the "/by" indication during user input
public Deadline(String name, String deadline) throws WrongInstructionException {
* This is an "event", a type of task
* It contains the start time and end time and a body
public Event(String name, String start, String end) throws WrongInstructionException {
throw new WrongInstructionException("Your start date invalid");
throw new WrongInstructionException("Your end date invalid");
return String.format("[E]%s (from: %s to: %s)", super.toString(), this.start, this.end);
* This class is for generating the standard greetings and goodbyes the bot may say to the user
* Bot uses this once at the start
System.out.println(" What can I do for you?");
* Bot users this once at the end when user input 'bye'
* Uses to say goodbye to the user
System.out.println(" Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
* Regurgitates the command types by the user
* @param s this is a command by the user
* This is task class; it will have children of specific task types
* It has a name, and an indication of whether it is done
* Marks the specific task instance to be complete
* Marks the specific task instance to be incomplete
* This is a taskList, it will maintain an array containing tasks on the list
* This method takes in a task and add it to our taskList
* @param task The task to be added into the list
* This method marks the task at the specified position to be "complete"
* @param index the position of the desired task - 1 (e.g task3 has index 2)
* This method marks the task at the specified position to be "incomplete"
* @param index the position of the desired task - 1 (e.g task3 has index 2)
* This method returns the task at the specified position
* @param index index is one less than position (e.g task3 has index 2)
* @return the object of the desired task
* This method returns the number of tasks in the list
* @return the number of tasks in the list
* This method removes the specified task from the list
* @param index the position of the task to be removed - 1 (e.g task3 has index 2)
* This is a specific type of task
* It just contains a task body
* This exception is for when components of a task input by the user are invalid
